definition: to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
variant of 飄|飘[piao1]
to float
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 蕩|荡[dang4]
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]

sentences.english: There were laughter and song in the air.
sentences.chinese: 麻雀在吱吱喳喳地叫着，空气中飘荡着欢歌笑语。

sentences.english: The air reeked of distillers' grains mixed in the pig feed.
sentences.chinese: 空气中飘荡着猪饲料中酒糟冒出的不锈钢管味道。

sentences.english: That floats on hight o'er vales and hills.
Dawn clouds frame the East Lamma Channel and Hong Kong Island.
sentences.chinese: 时值破晓，东博寮海峡和香港岛上浮云飘荡。

sentences.english: Another year recruiting season, the campus, curriculum vitae in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 又是一年招聘季，校园里，简历在风中飘荡。

sentences.english: Silence, then the Sunday sounds of our house by the lake.
sentences.chinese: 寂静，之后我们房屋周末的声音飘荡在湖边。

sentences.english: The fragrance of freshly brewed coffee wafted through the apartment.
sentences.chinese: 刚煮好的咖啡的那种清香，在整个房间里飘荡。

sentences.english: "Besame Mucho" and "Dancing in the Dark" are sultry romances wafted on light Latin beats.
sentences.chinese: “和”黑暗中的舞蹈“拉丁节奏的轻飘荡闷热的恋情。

sentences.english: Fiftyfive flags freely flutter from the floating frigate.
sentences.chinese: 五十五面旗子在微微沉没的战舰上自在的飘荡。
还是只是到处随风飘荡。

sentences.english: Now the carol of peace and prosperity prevails in the vast land of the Northern Anhui.
sentences.chinese: 盛世欢歌，飘荡在皖北大地上，余音绕梁。

sentences.english: On the day when the lotus bloomed, alas, my mind was straying, and I knew it not.
sentences.chinese: 莲花开放的那天，唉，我不自觉地在心魂飘荡。

sentences.english: The cloud is fluttering with the wind, roams through the vast sky ;
sentences.chinese: 云儿随风飘荡，徜徉于无际的天空。

sentences.english: It is when your spirit goes wondering upon the wind.
sentences.chinese: 当你的灵性随风飘荡的时候。

sentences.english: A Russian marine research ship has been at the sea for several months.
sentences.chinese: 一艘俄罗斯科学考察船在大洋上飘荡了好几个月。

sentences.english: That floats on high or vales and hills.

definition: to waft (through the air)/to drift
to float/to hover/also written 漂浮
to float/to drift
variant of 飄盪|飘荡[piao1 dang4]
to fly up/to dance in the air (of snowflakes, flower petals etc)
to curl up/to linger on (sound)
to float/to hover/to drift (also fig., to lead a wandering life)/to rove/showy/superficial
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
variant of 彌漫|弥漫[mi2 man4]
to ripple/to undulate
to ripple/to undulate/also written 蕩漾|荡漾
floating in the wind/swaying/tottering/unstable
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
to wave/to flutter/to fly
to dissipate everywhere (of light, sound, gas etc)
wind-borne/tossed about by the wind
to resound/to reverberate/to echo
